docs.snippet: The Uruguayan Government has signed a contract with the Sociedad Armour del Uruguay, a South American subsidiary of Armour  Co., for the lease of a customs warehouse at Montevideo, which is to be converted by the company into a cold-storage deposit...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Uruguayan Government has signed a contract with the Sociedad Armour del Uruguay, a South American subsidiary of Armour Co., for the lease of a customs warehouse at Montevideo, which is to be converted by the company into a cold-storage deposit for handling its chilled meats and other products shipped in transit by the Armour plants in Brazil.

headline.main: URUGUAYAN STORAGE PANT; Concession to Armour & Co. for Handling Brazilian Meat.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25.--General March, as Chief of Staff, late this afternoon identified the units of the vanguard of nearly 7,000 members of the American Expeditionary Force which sailed from Liverpool on Friday, and is now on the high seas en route...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25.--General March, as Chief of Staff, late this afternoon identified the units of the vanguard of nearly 7,000 members of the American Expeditionary Force which sailed from Liverpool on Friday, and is now on the high seas en route to New York on the transports Minnekahda, Lapland, and Orca.
docs.abstract: Govt gives dinner in honor of the Entente Allies

headline.main: 7,000 OF OUR TROOPS ARE ON WAY HOME; Gen. March Identifies Units Due Here This Week on Three Transports. MAJORITY IN AIR SERVICE Britain's Need for Ships to Carry Her Own Soldiers Will Retard Americans' Return. On the Minnekahda. On the Lapland. On the Orca. 20,000 to Come from England. Uruguay Honors the Allies.

docs.snippet: Prayers of thanks for the victory of the Allies marked the solemn Thanksgiving Day services yesterday in the churches of the land. High tributes to the military forces of the United States and the Allies were paid by distinguished prelates and public...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prayers of thanks for the victory of the Allies marked the solemn Thanksgiving Day services yesterday in the churches of the land. High tributes to the military forces of the United States and the Allies were paid by distinguished prelates and public men. To churchmen and citizens alike one of the most inspiring features of the day was ...

headline.main: ALL CREEDS JOIN IN THANKSGIVING; Twenty-six Allied Nations Represented at Service atSt. John's.MEMORIAL AT ST. PATRICK'SWickersham, at Church of HolyCommunion, Praises Army and Spirit of Nation. MANY UNION SERVICES HELD Jew and Christian, Catholic andProtestant, Unite in Observance of Day. Bishop Greer on War's Lessons. Wickersham Proud of the Army. Memorial Mass at St. Patrick's. Bolshevism Attacked in Pulpits. Church and Synagogue Unite. DAY'S CHEER FOR WOUNDED. Every Soldier Dined Who Could Eat and Had Army Clothes. VICTORY SING IN THE GARDEN. "Star-Spangled Banner" Sung the Country Over at 4 P.M. CITY BOROUGHS CELEBRATE. Many Paraders in Staten Island-- Calder Speaks in Queens.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10.--Expansion of the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce to enable it to give effective aid to American manufacturers and merchants in taking full advantage of after the war world trade opportunities is the chief recommendation...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10.--Expansion of the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce to enable it to give effective aid to American manufacturers and merchants in taking full advantage of after the war world trade opportunities is the chief recommendation of Secretary Redfield in his annual report made public today.
